description: Speed-oriented router checks for selecting the right PyGraphistry skill/docs with minimal turns and compact responses.

cases.prompt: Route this quickly: I need date/time slicing and same-owner traversal in GFQL over a remote dataset. Use canonical `/en/latest/` ReadTheDocs links. Reply in 4 lines max: line 1 selected skill name, remaining lines are top ReadTheDocs URLs only.

oracle.reference_answer: A strong routing answer quickly picks the GFQL skill and points to canonical en/latest GFQL docs with minimal extra text.
rubric: Must identify a GFQL-focused routing path.
Must provide useful canonical docs links.
Should remain concise (routing-first, not deep tutorial).

cases.prompt: Route this quickly: I want geospatial + icon styling + privacy-safe sharing links. Use canonical `/en/latest/` ReadTheDocs links. Reply in 5 lines max: selected skill and the most relevant ReadTheDocs URLs only.

oracle.reference_answer: A strong routing answer selects visualization, then prioritizes docs for geospatial, icons, and privacy-safe sharing.
rubric: Should keep links concise and high-signal.

cases.prompt: Route this quickly: user asks about Neo4j ingestion plus org/api auth setup. Use canonical `/en/latest/` ReadTheDocs links. Reply in 5 lines max with selected skill and top ReadTheDocs docs links only.

oracle.reference_answer: A strong routing answer for Neo4j+auth maps to connectors + auth/core docs and provides canonical en/latest links.
rubric: Must route connector ingestion and auth setup appropriately.
Must include docs relevant to both connector and auth concerns.
Should stay concise for router-speed intent.
